summary: The Small Business Administration provides physical disaster loans to help businesses, homeowners, and others rebuild damaged property and to assist with recovery in declared disaster areas. Through the Recovery Improvements for Small Entities (RISE) After Disaster Act of 2015, borrowers can obtain a loan for up to $25,000—instead of the previous $14,000 limit—without pledging any collateral. We reviewed more than 20 years of loan data...
title: Small Business Administration: Physical Disaster Loan Performance Before and After Changes in Statutory Collateral Requirements
